meanings.definition: The quality or state of being impudent or shameless.
meanings.sent1: Her impudicities were evident in the way she spoke to her elders without respect.
meanings.sent2: The impudicities of the young man shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent3: Despite his impudicities, he somehow managed to charm his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her impudicities were like a bright neon sign, impossible to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The impudicities of the politician were the talk of the town for weeks.

meanings.definition: An act or instance of being indecent or immoral.
meanings.sent1: The impudicities of the play caused quite a scandal among the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her impudicities at social gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The impudicities of the cat stealing food from the table were both amusing and annoying.
meanings.sent4: His impudicities in business dealings eventually led to his downfall.
meanings.sent5: The impudicities of the students during the exam were quickly reprimanded by the teacher.
